image.altText: The front entrance of Casuarina Prison at night as people mill around outside

props.synopsis: WA's Corruption and Crime Commission finds no evidence of serious misconduct among staff working the night WA recorded its first death in juvenile detention. WARNING: This story contains the name and image of an Indigenous person who has died.

title.children: Unit 18 set officers up 'to fail' and procedures 'undoubtedly' breached night Cleveland Dodd self harmed, says CCC report

image.altText: A wide shot of a green shack in front of sand dunes.

props.synopsis: The local council vows to continue its fight to remove the remaining 23 shacks at the Carnarvon Blowholes, despite the State Administrative Tribunal throwing the shack owners a lifeline.

title.children: West Australian town divided as fight over shack squatters looks set to continue

image.altText: A crushed can of mixer floats in the dirty incoming tide

props.synopsis: The Director of Liquor Licensing announces the sale of takeaway alcohol in the Kimberley town of Derby will be banned each Sunday and Monday, alongside further restrictions on trading hours in Broome.Â

title.children: Further booze bans to be introduced in WA's Kimberley, with limits on trading hours

image.altText: People stand around a car with all its doors open with a sign in beg letters on the wall behind reading BYD

props.synopsis: Chinese-made electric cars are gaining popularity as a cheaper alternative to brand names like Tesla, and Australia is benefiting from the increased supply.

title.children: Cheaper Chinese electric cars are making their way into Australia, but it's not all good news

image.altText: A court sketch shows Hunter Biden sitting in court.

props.synopsis: Hunter Biden becomes the first child of a sitting US president to be convicted of a crime after he's found guilty of three gun charges that could see him jailed.

title.children: 'I will always be there for Hunter': Joe Biden's show of support after jury convicts his son

image.altText: An aerial photo of a new housing estate with empty blocks and several new houses being built.

props.synopsis: Huge demand and lack of supply paint a grim picture for anyone saving to buy their first home, analysts warn.

title.children: 'Astronomical' property price growth to continue for foreseeable future, say analysts

image.altText: A split image shows two men wearing suits, one older with a tie, one younger

props.synopsis: The horrible truth is that in the Australian legacy media landscape, there are too many stories of senior men who forgive themselves their own lapses of judgement, or forgive each other's because they're "good blokes", or go easy on each other because they fear a nuclear escalation.

title.children: The shamelessness of powerful men in Australia's media industry knows no bounds

image.altText: A generic stock photo of a row of gloved hands holding up COVID-19 vaccines.

props.synopsis: Many Australians are preparing to head overseas and interstate these school holidays. Medical experts reveal how long before their travel they should be getting a booster.

title.children: How far in advance should I get a COVID-19 booster before travelling? Here's what the experts say

image.altText: A close up shot of Peter Dutton in glasses.

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton says the Coalition will wait until it has returned to power and looked at "the prevailing economic conditions" before it sets a 2030 climate target.

title.children: Dutton says Coalition will not set 2030 climate target before next election

image.altText: A logo of a school on a white building with trees in the back.

props.synopsis: About 50 students from Bacchus Marsh Grammar have reported images of their faces were used to create fake nude photos generated by AI. Police are investigating after the images of the girls, aged as young as 13, were circulated online.Â

title.children: 'It's appalling': Melbourne principal slams fake nude photos of female students believed to be generated using AI

image.altText: Model pic sent to scam victims

props.synopsis: In the Dubai desert lies a scam factory capable of swindling tens of thousands of people at a time. But one scammer has a secret plan that could shut the whole syndicate down.Â

title.children: Inside a secret scam factory where workers pretend to be glamorous models

image.altText: A courtroom sketch of Greg Lynn

props.synopsis: Prosecuting lawyers are making their final arguments in the murder trial of former Jetstar pilot Greg Lynn, who is charged with the murder of Carol Clay and Russell Hill.

title.children: 'A series of lowlights': Defence lawyers for Greg Lynn take aim at prosecution case in Supreme Court murder trial

image.altText: A man in a shirt, tie and jacket stands with the Sydney Harbour Bridge in the background.

props.synopsis:
Nicholas Sampson engaged high-profile barristers Arthur Moses SC and Sue Chrysanthou SC, and solicitor Rebekah Giles to represent him, before reaching the confidential settlement.


Â

title.children: Former Cranbrook headmaster reaches settlement with school over resignation 'confusion'

image.altText: An image of the Northern Territory Supreme Court building in Darwin.

props.synopsis: CCTV footage of the fatal stabbing of Darwin bottle shop worker Declan Laverty is played in court on day two of the murder trial of Keith Kerinauia, who is accused of murdering Mr Laverty at a BWS bottle shop in March 2023.

title.children: Keith Kerinauia murder trial hears witness accounts of bottle shop worker's fatal stabbing

image.altText: two people are looking at each other, a man is standing at a bar smiling, the woman is sitting, smiling and pointing at him.

props.synopsis: The leap from real life to the screen can be messy and content creators can find themselves in hot water in pursuit of 'real-life' storytelling.Â

title.children: 'Based on a true story': Netflix's Baby Reindeer and the blurry lines between fact and fiction

image.altText: A red haired woman smiles and looks down. A grey haired woman with glasses smiles and looks at her.,

props.synopsis:
Friends say Coral Seinor and Thelma Clausen, who died in a crash on the Brand Highway last Friday, looked for "any excuse" to organise a party and were founding members of their local Country Women's Association.

Â

title.children: 'Remarkable icons': Tributes flow for close friends killed in WA crash

image.altText: Kerry Whiting.

props.synopsis: A court hears from a young man who, while attempting to stop his mother being stabbed, caught sight of the alleged attacker who "looked me dead in the face â¦ and I saw it was my father".

title.children: Court told of moment teenager grabbed murder accused who 'looked me dead in the face and I saw that it was my father'

image.altText: A flight attendant posing inside a plane.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of employees of embattled budget airline Bonza are told their employment has been officially terminated at an online meeting.

title.children: 'IÂ just feel heartbroken': Sacked staff from collapsed airline Bonza chase their entitlements

image.altText: A man with grey curly hair wears a white face mask.

props.synopsis: A British judge who recently resigned from Hong Kong's top court warns the territory is "slowly becoming a totalitarian state" with its rule of law "profoundly compromised."

title.children: 'Profoundly compromised': Concerns over rule of law sees British judge quit Hong Kong's top court

image.altText: A composite of two women dressed in jijabs, one standing in front of a maple tree

props.synopsis: The Sydney Malayalee Community confirm the identities of two women who were swept into the ocean over the long weekend.Â

title.children: Sydney's Indian community mourning as two women 'swept off the rocks by freak wave'

image.altText: Jibril Rajoub  wearing a blue blazer and white button-down shirt

props.synopsis: Jibril Rajoub was denied a visa ahead of a FIFA World Cup qualification match in Perth on Tuesday, a month after pushing for Israel to be removed from FIFA over its actions in Palestine.

title.children: Palestinian football boss says Australia denied visa 'under the pressure' of Israel ahead of FIFA qualifier

image.altText: A man on a motorbike taking part in Finke Desert Race.

props.synopsis: NT Police have revealed further details of a Finke Desert Race campfire explosion which left six Victorian men with significant burns.

title.children: Group 'sprayed with boiling oil' after shock absorber explodes at Finke Desert Race campsite

image.altText: A man speaking with his arm raised, standing at a green seat.

props.synopsis: As tensions simmer in Canberra over serious criminals keeping their Australian visas, figures show the tribunal that reviews those cases has been increasingly overturning cancellations for years in cases where someone's character is being questioned.

title.children: Dangerous criminals have had their visas reinstated in Australia for years, well before 'direction 99'. This is why

image.altText: Sam Wallace-Joseph wears a rainbow ribbon in her hair and she practises shooting before the Swifts play in Inclusion Round

props.synopsis: Two-time Super Netball champion Sam Wallace-Joseph appears to have played her last game for the NSW Swifts, as the Melbourne Vixens jump the West Coast Fever into top spot and Diamonds shooter Sophie Garbin hits 50 goals for a second straight week.

title.children: Beloved Swift Wallace-Joseph on the out as club talks with management about behaviour

image.altText: Two timber jetty piles in the water with significant damage. One has a hole you can see all the way through

props.synopsis: An engineers' report obtained under Freedom of Information shows the jetty chosen to host Bunbury's long-awaited public fishing platform had been recommended for decommissioning just months prior.

title.children: Report reveals WA government knew regional jetty was unviable prior to fix worth almost half a million dollars

image.altText: Young children eating sandwhiches.

props.synopsis: Western Australia's community centres once hosted gardening groups and elderly fitness classes, but they've quickly had to funnel resources into emergency food relief for kids.

title.children: Community centre delivers 20 tonnes of food relief to cold, hungry families in mining-rich state

image.altText: Michael Mosley speaks on a morning talk show wearing a blazer, blue shirt and glasses

props.synopsis: British TV presenter Michael Mosley died of natural causes, with a post-mortem examination finding no evidence of foul play.Â

title.children: 'He very nearly made it': TV doctor Michael Mosley died from natural causes after 'incredible climb', his wife says

image.altText: CCTV of two young men looking around a home

props.synopsis: More than 40,000 Queenslanders want Castle Law to use lethal force against home intruders, but the law society says existing laws allowing reasonable force have served the community well.

title.children: 'Criminals will fight back': Proposed new law allowing people to kill home intruders not perfect, victim warns

image.altText: A graphic of a nuclear power plant with a nuclear symbol and the numbers 2040 and 2045 in the foreground

props.synopsis: As the shift away from fossil fuels gathers pace, the Coalition has turned to an emissions-free technology with a long and contentious history â nuclear fission. These are the numbers you should keep in mind when thinking about its place in Australia's energy transition.

title.children: Would a nuclear power plant fit Australia's needs? These numbers cut through the debate

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: A 44-year-old Canberra man is charged with a range of offences after a woman was found running screaming and naked along a street on Monday evening, police say.

title.children: Man charged after woman allegedly found running naked and screaming along Canberra street

image.altText: A grey short-hair cat sits on an open laptop on a home office desk.

props.synopsis: Australians are being warned this tax time not to double dip on working-from-home claims, make sure they have detailed records of expenses and not to lodge their tax returns too early.

title.children: Tax time is fast approaching and the ATO has a warning to those with work-from-home claims

image.altText: Woman standing in front of a mural of herself.

props.synopsis: As Caitlin Foord prepares for her third Olympics, a stunning 14-metre-high mural in Wollongong celebrates her journey. The mural captures her dynamic style and features her beloved dog, Peach, inspiring young athletes to dream big.

title.children: 'Pinch me moment': Matildas star honoured with a 14-metre mural in her home town of Wollongong

image.altText: Man wearing red top and large S chain smiles at camera.

props.synopsis: Two boys aged 12 have been convicted of the murder of a 19-year-old man who was fatally stabbed in England last year.Â

title.children: Boys, 12, found guilty of murdering man in machete attack

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt being escorted by a detective in plain clothes.

props.synopsis: Details about the days leading up to the death of Diana Hanbury are revealed during a bail application for her father Adam Hanbury.

title.children: Parents charged with murder over death of 'gravely unwell' toddler believed she may have been teething, court told

image.altText: A 1970s TV still of an older, balding man with a moustache and wiry eyebrows

props.synopsis: Robert Baudin printed around $2 million in fake US notes. When he (eventually) faced court, he took to the air and threatened to crash into Sydney Harbour.

title.children: This man told his wife he was printing pornography. What he was doing was much more sinister
